product_overview: GLA WMS is a Warehouse Management System designed to optimize logistics operations focusing on detailed control of order picking, verification, and counter service processes to ensure traceability and efficiency.
core_goals: Provide a robust and responsive platform to manage order flow from ERP input to final order verification.
Enable efficient and secure management of warehouse workflows including picking, verification, and counter service.
Ensure data integrity and reliability in concurrent environments with locking and audit mechanisms.
Offer role-based access control to ensure proper authorization levels for supervisors, pickers, verifiers, and counter attendants.
Support mobile and desktop optimized interfaces for different user roles.
key_features: Secure login with session-based cookie authentication and role-based access control (RBAC).
Order management with statuses covering from pending to finalized, synchronized with ERP.
Work unit management with locking, TTL, and heartbeat to prevent concurrent conflicts.
Detailed warehouse operations for picking (separação), verification (conferência), and exception handling.
Supervisor dashboard for managing users and orders with unlocking capabilities.
Auditing and logging for traceability of all critical actions.
Integration with barcode scanners for product validation.
Exception recording for damaged or missing items during processing.
user_flow_summary: User logs in through secure authentication and is assigned role-based access to features.
Supervisors manage users, unlock tasks, view dashboards, and oversee orders.
Pickers receive locked work units to process order picking and scanning of items.
Verification users confirm picked items, record exceptions if any, and finalize orders.
Counter attendants manage quick delivery orders and attend customer orders at the counter.
All actions are logged for auditing and supervisors can perform forced unlocks if needed.
validation_criteria: All users must authenticate successfully before gaining access to system features.
RBAC properly restricts or grants access based on user roles.
Order status transitions correctly reflect the workflow states without skipping steps.
Locks on work units prevent multiple users from processing the same order simultaneously.
Audit logs capture all critical actions including user identity, timestamps, and changes made.
Barcode scanning integration correctly validates product items during picking and verification.
Exception cases (damaged, missing, expired items) must be recorded and associated with relevant orders.
Performance benchmarks ensure responsive UI on both mobile collectors and desktop devices.
Supervisors must be able to create, update, delete users and unlock tasks as needed.
